intro: Acsmithia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined acsmithia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is native to certain regions of Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known.
